data.text:
Today I have had a little time and had listend to some scores from this great composer. All what I can say is: I am very impressed by his arrangements!

Visit this site and listen to his great music!

https://www.screenarchives.com/composer.cfm?composerID=171

Edit: Click on the CD`s pictures on the link I posted, and then there you can listen to many audio examples, and then think about arranging, knowledge of composing e.t.c. .... .

o-[][]-o

Re: How to do great arrangements...., Composer "Bronislau Kaper"

Yes, great stuff from the good ol' days. Such as this:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZOudGh8psEo

However today, we have to be Epic composers. We are like Transformers, and each piece has to be more epic that the other guys.

And any old styles won't do anymore, its got to be trendy (what's Han's doing now?).

And LOUD (how does TJ do it?).

One-ups-man-ship is the name of the game - like Charlie Sheen says. If you're not winning, you need a new sample library.

Its like WWE sports dude. Epic winning. Bi-winning!

o=? o=?

No more chance just to write different styles of music simply because they compliment the film. That's so "last century"! :wink:

Re: How to do great arrangements...., Composer "Bronislau Kaper"

Yes but with samples, we are free to do anything!

Yet, we still restrict ourselves. Odd isn't it?

We are like freed slaves that prefer to stay close to our master.

As Wendy Carlos said, we have a whole chess board to play on, yet, we are all crowding in on the same square.

Sorry, I was in a cynical mood.... :? But we can learn from cynicism too.

I'm a bit cheerier today.

Actually, I think the reason everyone's targeting the same chess square is that's the one that's making money. If other squares were also profitable, I think people would gravitate there too.
